data.chText: 希望（不大可能的事）发生；怀着（不可能实现的）愿望

before.chText: 通常不用于现在进行时
before.enText: not usually used in the present progressive tense

data.enText: to want sth to happen or to be true even though it is unlikely or impossible

data.chText: 我要是个子高一些就好了。
data.enText: I wish I were taller.

data.chText: 我要是个子高一些就好了。
data.enText: I wish I was taller.

data.chText: 我倒希望我没有吃这么多。
data.enText: I wish I hadn't eaten so much.

data.chText: “他现在在哪儿？”“我要是知道就好了！”
data.enText: ‘Where is he now?’ ‘ I only wish I knew!’

data.chText: 我真希望你不把衣服丢得满地都是。
data.enText: I wish you wouldn't leave your clothes all over the floor.

data.text: ‘That’ is nearly always left out, especially in speech.
尤其在口语中that几乎总是给省略掉。

data.chText: 他死了，希望他死而复生是无济于事的。
data.enText: He's dead and it's no use wishing him alive again.

data.chText: 她恨不得自己远在百万英里之外。
data.enText: She wished herself a million miles away.

data.chText: 希望（做某事）；想要（某事发生）
data.enText: to want to do sth; to want sth to happen

data.chText: 如果你愿意，你可以一直待到早晨。
data.enText: You may stay until morning, if you wish .

data.chText: “现在我最好还是不说话。”“悉听尊便。”
data.enText: ‘I'd rather not talk now.’ ‘ (Just) as you wish .’

data.chText: 这门课程是为想要提高电脑技术的人而设的。
data.enText: This course is designed for people wishing to update their computer skills.

data.chText: 我想跟经理说话。
data.enText: I wish to speak to the manager.

data.chText: 我不想无礼，但请您安静一点儿好吗？
data.enText: I don't wish (= I don't mean) to be rude, but could you be a little quieter?

data.chText: 她不能相信他希望她受到伤害。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: She could not believe that he wished her harm.

data.chText: 他说不准他到底是希望她留下还是离开。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: He was not sure whether he wished her to stay or go.

data.chText: 盼望；企求；想要
data.enText: to think very hard that you want sth, especially sth that can only be achieved by good luck or magic

data.chText: 她闭上眼睛盼祷他好起来。
data.enText: She shut her eyes and wished for him to get better.

data.chText: 心诚则灵。
data.enText: If you wish really hard, maybe you'll get what you want.

data.chText: 企求不可能的事情是徒劳无益的。
data.enText: It's no use wishing for the impossible.

data.chText: 他可能想要的一切东西他都有了。
data.enText: He has everything he could possibly wish for.

data.chText: 祝；祝愿
data.enText: to say that you hope that sb will be happy, lucky, etc.

data.chText: 我祝她生日快乐。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: I wished her a happy birthday.

data.chText: 祝我交好运吧！
data.enText: Wish me luck!

data.chText: 我们祝愿他们两位退休后颐养天年。
data.enText: We wish them both well in their retirement.
I wish!

data.chText: 但愿如此（但不可能或不大可能）
data.enText: used to say that sth is impossible or very unlikely, although you wish it were possible

data.chText: “你到明天就完成了。”“但愿如此！”
data.enText: ‘You'll have finished by tomorrow.’ ‘I wish!’
wish sth away

data.chText: 从心里竭力摆脱；希望…不再存在
data.enText: to try to get rid of sth by wishing it did not exist
wish sb/sth on sb

data.chText: 想让…有（不愉快的事）
data.enText: to want sb to have sth unpleasant

data.chText: 即使是我的死对头，我也不想他出那样的事。
data.enText: I wouldn't wish something like that on my worst enemy.

data.chText: 愿望；希望
data.enText: a desire or a feeling that you want to do sth or have sth

data.chText: 她表示希望一个人待着。
data.enText: She expressed a wish to be alone.

data.chText: 他无意挑衅。
data.enText: He had no wish to start a fight.

data.chText: 我可以理解她想保守秘密的愿望。
data.enText: I can understand her wish for secrecy.

data.chText: 他最大的愿望是能再次见到自己的孙子孙女。
data.enText: His dearest wish (= what he wants most of all) is to see his grandchildren again.

data.chText: 想要的东西；希望的事
data.enText: a thing that you want to have or to happen

data.chText: 实现某人的愿望
data.enText: to carry out sb's wishes

data.chText: 我相信你会心想事成。
data.enText: I'm sure that you will get your wish.

data.chText: 她违背父母的愿望嫁给了别的人。
data.enText: She married against her parents' wishes .

data.chText: 愿；心愿
data.enText: an attempt to make sth happen by thinking hard about it, especially in stories when it often happens by magic

data.chText: 往喷泉里扔些钱，许个愿。
data.enText: Throw some money in the fountain and make a wish .

data.chText: 精灵准许他实现三个心愿。
data.enText: The genie granted him three wishes.

data.chText: 王子的愿望实现了。
data.enText: The prince's wish came true .

data.chText: （书信或贺卡等中的）祝愿，祝福
data.enText: used especially in a letter or card to say that you hope that sb will be happy, well or successful

data.chText: 我们都对未来致以最好的祝愿。
data.enText: We all send our best wishes for the future.

data.chText: 请替我向全家致意。
data.enText: Give my good wishes to the family.

data.chText: 祝好（如信中结尾语）
data.enText: With best wishes (= for example, at the end of a letter)
if wishes were horses, beggars would/might ride

data.chText: 想有不见得就有；愿望不等于事实
data.enText: wishing for sth does not make it happen
your wish is my command

data.chText: 我唯阁下之命是从
data.enText: used to say that you are ready to do whatever sb asks you to do
the wish is father to the thought

data.chText: 希望什么就相信什么
data.enText: we believe a thing because we want it to be true

data.chText: 动词wish作第1义时，后面的that从句总是用过去时：
data.enText: After the verb wish in sense 1, a past tense is always used in a that clause.

data.chText: 你希望有个更好的工作吗？
data.enText: Do you wish (that) you had a better job?

data.chText: 在更正式的英语，尤其是北美英语中，许多人在I、he、she、it之后用were，而不用was：
data.enText: In more formal English, especially in NAmE , many people use were after I , he , she , it instead of was .

data.chText: 要是他今晚在这儿就好了。
data.enText: I wish he were here tonight.

means: 怀着(不可能实现的)愿望

ex.chText: 我希望成为一个有用的人。
ex.enText: I hope to become a useful man.

ex.chText: 我们希望年内能访问美国。
ex.enText: We hope that we can visit the United States this year.

synonyms.bx: 指盼望得到好的或有利的结果，并对此持有一定的信心。

ex.chText: 我要是像你们那么年轻该多好啊！
ex.enText: I wish I were as young as you.

ex.chText: 我要是10年前遇到那么好的老师就好了。
ex.enText: I wish (that) I had met that good teacher 10 years ago.

ex.chText: 只是盼望出现奇迹没什么用。
ex.enText: It was no use wishing for a miracle.

synonyms.bx: 多用于与事实相反的情况，尤用于难于实现或不可能实现的愿望。

data.enText: I wish!

data.chText: 但愿如此（但不可能或不大可能）
data.enText: used to say that sth is impossible or very unlikely, although you wish it were possible

data.chText: “你到明天就完成了。”“但愿如此！”
data.enText: ‘You'll have finished by tomorrow.’ ‘I wish!’
if wishes were horses, beggars would/might ride

data.chText: 想有不见得就有；愿望不等于事实
data.enText: wishing for sth does not make it happen
your wish is my command

data.chText: 我唯阁下之命是从
data.enText: used to say that you are ready to do whatever sb asks you to do
the wish is father to the thought

data.chText: 希望什么就相信什么
data.enText: we believe a thing because we want it to be true
wish sth away

data.chText: 从心里竭力摆脱；希望…不再存在
data.enText: to try to get rid of sth by wishing it did not exist
wish sb/sth on sb

data.chText: 想让…有（不愉快的事）
data.enText: to want sb to have sth unpleasant

data.chText: 即使是我的死对头，我也不想他出那样的事。
data.enText: I wouldn't wish something like that on my worst enemy.

tr: the particular preference that you have
example: they should respect the wishes of the people

tr: (usually plural) a polite expression of desire for someone's welfare
an expression of some desire or inclination
example: I could tell that it was his wish that the guests leave
his crying was an indirect request for attention
he was above all wishing and desire
I wish that Christmas were over
I wish I could go home now

tr: feel or express a desire or hope concerning the future or fortune of
prefer or wish to do something
example: Do you care to try this dish?
Would you like to come along to the movies?

value.def: A wish is a desire or strong feeling that you want to have something or do something.

example.ex: She was sincere and genuine in her wish to make amends for the past...
example.tran: 她真诚地希望弥补从前的过失。

example.ex: Clearly she had no wish for conversation...
example.tran: 她显然无意谈话。

example.ex: She wanted to go everywhere in the world. She soon got her wish...
example.tran: 她想走遍世界，很快便如愿以偿。

example.ex: The decision was made against the wishes of the party leader.
example.tran: 这个决定违背了该党领导人的意愿。

value.def: If you wish to do something or to have it done for you, you want to do it or have it done.

example.ex: If you wish to go away for the weekend, our office will be delighted to make hotel reservations...
example.tran: 如果您想外出度周末，我们办事处将很乐意为您预订旅馆。

example.ex: We can dress as we wish now...
example.tran: 我们现在着装可以随心所欲。

example.ex: There were the collaborators, who wished for a German victory.
example.tran: 有通敌者希望德国获胜。

value.def: Wish is used in expressions such as I don't wish to be rude or without wishing to be rude as a way of apologizing or warning someone when you are going to say something which might upset, annoy, or worry them.

example.ex: I don't wish to sound callous, but I am glad I wasn't here...
example.tran: 我不想让自己的话听上去麻木不仁，但我真的很庆幸我当时没在这儿。

example.ex: Without wishing to be unkind, she's not the most interesting company.
example.tran: 我不想那么刻薄，不过她并不是非常有情趣的伴侣。

value.tran: (用于要说的话可能使人不快或担心等时)不想，无意

value.def: If you wish something were true, you would like it to be true, even though you know that it is impossible or unlikely.

example.ex: I wish I could do that...
example.tran: 我希望我能做那件事。

example.ex: I wish it weren't true...
example.tran: 但愿这不是真的。

example.ex: Pa, I wish you wouldn't shout...
example.tran: 爸，我希望你不要嚷嚷了。

example.ex: The world is not always what we wish it to be.
example.tran: 世界并不总是如我们所愿。

value.tran: 希望(不可能或可能性很小的事发生)

value.boxu_tran: 注意wish 与 want 虽意思相近，但用法不同。want 表示感觉需要或希望拥有某物，可以说 want to do something, want someone to do something 或 want something to happen。如果 wish 与带 to 的不定式连用，则与 want 意思相同，但语气要更正式：I want to get out of here (我想离开这里), She wished to consult him about her future (她想就自己未来的发展向他咨询意见)。wish 一般后接 that 从句，但从句中的 that 经常省略，表示虽然明知不太可能或完全没有可能，依然希望某事是真的：I wish I lived near London (我真希望自己住在伦敦附近)，He wished he had phoned for a cab (他真希望自己已经打电话叫出租车了)。注意上述例子中时态的用法：wish 用现在时，则从句用过去时;wish 用过去时，则从句用过去完成时。
value.boxu_usage: Note that wish and want have similar meanings, but are used differently. If you want something, you feel a need for it or a desire to have it. You can say that you want to do something, that you want someone to do something, or that you want something to happen. If you use wish with a 'to' infinitive, this has the same meaning as want but is more formal. I want to get out of here... She wished to consult him about her future. Wish is normally followed by a 'that'-clause, although the word 'that' is often omitted from the clause. If you wish that something was the case, you would like it to be the case, even though this is unlikely or impossible. I wish I lived near London... He wished he had phoned for a cab. Note the use of the tenses in the examples; when wish is in the present tense, the past tense is used in the clause, and when wish is in the past tense, the past perfect tense is used in the clause.

value.def: If you wish for something, you express the desire for that thing silently to yourself. In fairy stories, when a person wishes for something, the thing they wish for often happens by magic.

example.ex: We have all wished for men who are more considerate...
example.tran: 我们都曾祈求能找到更加体贴的男人。

example.ex: A philosopher once said, 'Be careful what you wish for; you might get it.'
example.tran: 一位哲学家曾说过：“别轻易许愿——你可能会如愿以偿。”

example.ex: Blow out the candles and make a wish.
example.tran: 吹蜡烛许愿吧。

value.def: Wish is used in sentences such as I could not wish for anything better to indicate that you are very pleased with what you have and could not imagine anything better.

example.ex: I really could not have wished for a better teacher...
example.tran: 这个老师对我来说是再好不过的了。

example.ex: Who could wish for a better opportunity?
example.tran: 谁还会企求能得到比这更好的机会呢？

value.tran: 这是再好不过的;没有比这更好的了

value.def: If you say that you would not wish a particular thing on someone, you mean that the thing is so unpleasant that you would not want them to be forced to experience it.

example.ex: It's a horrid experience and I wouldn't wish it on my worst enemy.
example.tran: 这种经历太痛苦了，我甚至都不希望它发生在死对头身上。

value.def: If you wish someone something such as luck or happiness, you express the hope that they will be lucky or happy.

example.ex: I wish you both a very good journey...
example.tran: 我祝愿你们两人旅途愉快。

example.ex: Goodbye, Hanu. I wish you well.
example.tran: 再见，哈努，祝你顺心如意。

value.def: If you express your good wishes towards someone, you are politely expressing your friendly feelings towards them and your hope that they will be successful or happy.

example.ex: I found George's story very sad. Please give him my best wishes...
example.tran: 我觉得乔治的经历很悲惨，请向他转达我最诚挚的祝福。

example.ex: Western leaders sent good wishes to the new American president.
example.tran: 西方领导人向新任美国总统致以良好的祝愿。

trans: 如你所愿；如你所願；如意；如妳所願
祝你幸福；祝你快乐；祝你愉快；希望你幸福
希望一览表(指所有希望得到的东西或全部希望发生的事情)
远走高飞；不停地表示愿望
